headline: Invesco’s Dividend And Buyback Resolve Amid Quarterly Losses Might Change The Case For Investing In Invesco (IVZ)
summary: Invesco Ltd. recently reported fourth-quarter 2025 revenue of US$1,692 million and full-year revenue of US$6,377.1 million, but moved from prior profitability to a net loss of US$1,061.1 million for the quarter and US$281.7 million for the year, while maintaining its common and preferred cash dividends and continuing share repurchases under its long-running buyback program. This combination of revenue growth, a swing to losses, ongoing dividends of US$0.21 per common share and US$14.75 per...

headline: 'This probably seems overdone': Wall Street strategists weigh in on software stock sell-off
summary: Software stocks have led tech lower in recent weeks. Wall Street strategists say the move may be overdone.

raw.headline: 'This probably seems overdone': Wall Street strategists weigh in on software stock sell-off

headline: Invesco Swings To Loss As Capital Returns And Expectations Face Test
summary: Invesco (NYSE:IVZ) reported a swing to a net loss for the fourth quarter of 2025. The company also recorded a net loss for the full year 2025, even though revenues were higher. This shift from profitability to a loss highlights a material change in Invesco's recent financial performance. For investors, the move into loss territory comes as Invesco's share price stands at $26.82, with the stock up 48.1% over the past year and 65.1% over 3 years. That kind of longer-term share price strength,...
